sentences.english: Don't cut your finger on the broken glass.
sentences.chinese: 别让碎玻璃割伤你的手。

sentences.english: Slice like a pro without risking a cut.
sentences.chinese: 像专业人士那样切片也不用担心割伤。

sentences.english: Cutting edge rolling pin rolls, cuts, and stores all in one.
sentences.chinese: 擀面杖卷刃，割伤，并存储于一身。

sentences.english: What's the first thing you do when you burn or cut one of your hands?
sentences.chinese: 当你不小心烫伤或者割伤了手，你首先会做什么呢？

sentences.english: The hospital has said, sword has a slight man hands cut, has put on the gauze.
sentences.chinese: 医院方面称，动刀男子双手有轻微割伤，已缠上纱布。

sentences.english: I have a cut on each hand.
sentences.chinese: 我每只手上都有一处割伤。

sentences.english: Selina cut herself while peeling an apple.
sentences.chinese: 当珊珊在削萍果皮时，她割伤了自己。

sentences.english: She's 16 now and hasn't cut herself in more than a year.
sentences.chinese: 她现在16岁了，她已经没有割伤自己有一年多了。

sentences.english: "Careful not to cut yourselves, " Tao shouted out cheerily.
sentences.chinese: “小心不要被割伤，”导游陶乐呵呵地提醒道。

sentences.english: He escaped with only minor cuts and bruises.
sentences.chinese: 他逃脱了，只有轻微的割伤和瘀伤。

sentences.english: He wounded his arm while using the knife.
sentences.chinese: 他用刀的时候把自己手臂割伤了。

sentences.english: Bob cut himself by fooling around with a sharp knife.
sentences.chinese: 鲍勃粗心大意，用快刀把自己割伤了。

sentences.english: The knife slipped and cut my hand.
sentences.chinese: 刀子一滑，把我的手割伤了。

sentences.english: I am worried if the poet could be incised wound by the paper’s edge.
sentences.chinese: 我担心诗人会否被生活的纸锋割伤。

sentences.english: Some people who cut themselves have problems with drug or alcohol abuse.
sentences.chinese: 有些割伤自己的人有吸毒或酗酒问题。

definition: to damage by scratching/to gash/to lacerate
to abrade/to scrape/to chafe/to graze/abrasion/friction burn/scratch
to injure by scratching or clawing
to wound with a blade or hatchet/to slash/to gash
to cut open/to rip/to streak across (lightning, meteor etc)/to pierce (scream, searchlight etc)
to hit with a piercing blow
to injure oneself in a fall
